channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2023110216
item.description:
Report E-2023110216

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: SCOTT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 1, 2023, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the concrete dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from OMI/E3 to remediate the impacted site. OMI/E3 deconstructed the pallet and removed two (2) 50 pound bags from the pallet. The crew collected the released material with and tools. OMI/E3 placed the released material and two (2) damaged bags into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110051
item.description:
Report X-2023110051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: SAINT ROSE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REFUSED BY THE CUSTOMER BECAUSE THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE WAS ALL WET FROM THE LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE ETHANOL CONTAINERS. ONCE DRIVER RETURNED THE PACKAGE IT WAS PLACED IMMEDIATELY INSIDE A HAZMAT BIN FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION THE CONTAINER HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING LEAKAGE WHILE BEING TRANSPORTED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BIN TO MITIGATE THE LEAKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023110024
item.description:
Report X-2023110024

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in unload by package handler. QA noticed it was a dry wet spot, on the box. Taking a look inside QA noticed that the product said it was Sulfuric Acid. There was no labeling on package to state it was a hazmat. QA checked for the SDS and it was an actually Hazardous material. QA got a red tote and brought package to the hazmat area. DescribePack: The cap on the bottle was loose and spilled out inside box. The peanuts inside did not cover the bottles entirely. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Brought package to hazmat area in red tote to be processed properly.

item.title: Report X-2023110021
item.description:
Report X-2023110021

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in unload damaged with the box being wet on both sides. At first QA assumed that the package was damaged by another package but after taking a closer look at package it was damaged from the inside. QA got a red tote and transported the hazmat to the rightful place to processed properly. DescribePack: The package had no inner packing inside the package, which highly caused the bottle's cap to become loose. No care was put in transporting a corrosive hazardous item. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA placed hazmat in red tote and brought it to the hazmat area to be processed properly.

item.title: Report X-2023101407
item.description:
Report X-2023101407

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the trailer leaking. After clearing everyone out, the manager called for QA to check on package. QA got a red tote to clean up as well as some neutralizer to clear out the liquid that was on the truck. Some packages were affected by the hazmat, a IC package and two sets of tires. QA brought the hazmat, IC, and tires to hazmat cage to process properly. DescribePack: One can was damaged from the bottom of the can. It was noticeable leaking from a hole which damaged the other cans as well. The acid leaked through the box and the whole bottom of the package was gone. The shipper did not pack any inner packing to protect the products from getting damaged unacceptable when shipping out hazmats. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a red tote, put the lid on top of box and transported the hazmat to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023101364
item.description:
Report X-2023101364

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in unload by a package handler trainer and they place in a bin. Manager notified QA when they found it that the package is in unload. QA got a red tote, put the damaged hazmat box in tote and brought the tote to the hazmat area to be worked on. DescribePack: The package was leaking from the bottom and the corrosive liquid ate through the box. The liquid leaked because of the loose caps. The package had no inner packing to stop the items from getting damaged. Possibly the hazmat was turned over on its side is a possibility that it leaked as well. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a red tote, put the lid on top of box and transported the hazmat to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023101187
item.description:
Report X-2023101187

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tank car was seen by UPRR yard personnel to be leaking as it was being moved in the Reisor Yard in Shreveport LA. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. Mgr. Robinson called an emergency response contractor, and they got on site before he did. The car was leaking from a misaligned man way gasket and needed to be replaced. The gasket was replaced, and the man way was properly secured and the top and sides of the car wiped down so it could continue in transportation.
